Comment:
Hi everyone!

In a MT commemorating the victims of the Christchurch Earthquake I got to play my buddy, Steve who is an up and coming Class B 1600+ player.  He is a serious threat to me because I have lost to him in a Traxler MT and playing black in the Japanese Earthquake MT I ended up conceding a Low Draw to him.  So I got my revenge in kind with a humble pawn.  How did this happen?  Well, if you follow the annotation and the following gameknot analysis link you will see just how it happened.  http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=15655565&fb=1&rnd=0.37816544131776747.  Steve kicks off with 1. Nf3, the Reti Opening.
4. ...... Nf6 - I was tempted to exchange knights here but I did not yet want to bring the Wicked Witch of the West onto a such a commanding square so I decided to develop a piece.

12. ..... d6 - another hedgehog looking jstevens1 position.  White now decides to try and break it up, but will he end up being spiked on the hedgehog?  We shall see.  ("Spiked on the hedgehog" is a Jospeak way of describing my opponent losing material as a result of injudicious incursions into my position).

14. ..... Nb8 - this innocent looking retreat uncovers an attack on the c4 pawn.  Steve notices this and decides to stab at my knight.  I decided to exchange bishops on f3.

17. Rcd1? - this tempting attack on Glenda will now result in white dropping a pawn.  Glenda will now defend the pawn on e5.  She is also attacking (well, that makes a change!) the white pawn on c5.

25. Qg4?? - oh dear, oh dear, oh dear, this move allows the gain of a whole rook, do you see how?

27. .... Rxf8?? - I give this move two question marks because I made it so automatically.  In the endgame it should have been Henry going to this square and not my rook and my rook should have kept on the c column putting pressure on that weak pawn on c4.  Thankfully my opponent allows my advanced knight to manoeuvre round and wreak havoc on white's queenside pawns.

32. .... Rc8 - after this move Steve waved the white flag after my rook on c8 chases away the defender of the pawn on a5, leaving my pawn on a6 the possible glory of Glendadom.  Steve does not wish to see this and so I ended up with nearly 6 rating points in the bank.  Nice.
